Servitude.definition: a condition in which an individual lacks liberty esp. to determine his or her course of action or way of life ;specif

1.definition: a condition in which an individual lacks liberty esp. to determine his or her course of action or way of lifethe state of being a slave [involuntary ] see alsoandto thein the back matter

2.definition: a right by which property owned by one person is subject to a specified use or enjoyment of another used chiefly in the civil law of Louisiana see alsoandatcompare

apparent servitude.definition: a predial servitude whose existence is perceivable by exterior signs or works (as an aqueduct or road) on the property

legal servitude.definition: a predial servitude that is created by a limitation under the law on the use of the property

natural servitude.definition: a predial servitude that arises from the situation of the estates (as from one being situated downhill from another)

personal servitude.definition: a servitude that burdens property in favor of a specific named person see also,

predial servitude.definition: a servitude that burdens one item of immovable property (as a tract of land) in favor of another
predial servitude.note: A predial servitude is transferred along with the ownership of the dominant estate, and the servient estate is always taken subject to the servitude. A predial servitude cannot be transferred separately from the dominant estate.
